triples.name: Corpus linguistics
triples.relevance: The paper presents a major multilingual corpus for parliamentary proceedings, exemplifying corpus linguistics methodology

triples.name: Universal Dependencies
triples.relevance: The corpora are annotated following the Universal Dependencies formalism for linguistic annotation

triples.name: Named-entity recognition
triples.relevance: The corpora include linguistic annotation with named entities for identifying persons, organizations, and locations

triples.name: CLARIN
triples.relevance: The complete corpora are openly available through the CLARIN.SI repository as part of the European Research Infrastructure

triples.name: GitHub
triples.relevance: Samples of the corpora and conversion scripts are available from the project's GitHub repository

triples.name: Concordancer
triples.relevance: The corpora are accessible through NoSketch Engine and KonText concordancers for analysis and exploration

triples.name: Text annotation
triples.relevance: The corpora employ linguistic annotation with rich metadata and syntactic/semantic information

triples.name: Transcripts of legislative bodies
triples.relevance: The paper presents transcriptions of sessions from 17 European national parliaments, creating a major parliamentary discourse corpus
